heidelberg.de] |BÃ¼rgermeister = Dr. Eckart WÃ¼rzner |BÃ¼rgermeistertitel=
OberbÃ¼rgermeister |Partei = Parteilos }} 'Heidelberg' is a city in south-west
Germany. The fifth-largest city in the State of Baden-WÃ¼rttemberg after
Stuttgart, Mannheim, Karlsruhe and Freiburg im Breisgau, Heidelberg is part of
the densely populated Rhine-Neckar Metropolitan Region. In 2011, over 149,000
people lived in the city. Heidelberg lies on the River Neckar in a steep valley
in the Odenwald.

A former residence of the Electorate of the Palatinate, Heidelberg is the
location of Heidelberg University, well known far beyond Germany's borders.
Heidelberg is a popular tourist destination due to its romantic and picturesque
cityscape, including Heidelberg Castle and the baroque style Old Town.
headings: Notable people who died in Heidelberg
